item.title: Session Slides and/or Recordings Are Posted
item.description: Slides and/or recordings for sessions are now available!  The session description pages will include links to the YouTube recording as well as the slides. If a session does not have either a recording or the slides, it's because the speaker hasn't provided them to us. We are still reminding speakers to upload their materials.
item.dc:creator: jdearie

item.title: Yes , we will be posting session recordings and slides
item.description: There were so many awesome sessions this year, that we know there's no way you made it to all of them. We will be posting session recordings and slides, but we are still pulling all of them together.
item.dc:creator: jdearie

item.title: Extended Code Sprints!
item.description:
The FUN does not stop with the closing!!

In fact, you can join Forum One for more code fun in DuPont for the extended Drupal 8 Core Code sprint.

Saturday, July 25 - Sunday, July 26
Location: Forum One, 1110 Vermont Ave. NW, Suite 500, Washington, DC 20005
item.dc:creator: Bendygirl

item.title: National Cancer Institute UX Lab Tour
item.description: During Drupal GovCon the National Cancer Institute will be giving tours of their user experience lab. The tour will be held from 12-1pm each day, Wednesday, Thursday and Friday. The lab is OFF CAMPUS, so keep that in mind if you want to take a tour.
item.dc:creator: admin

item.title: We may be Sold Out...but if you're Registered, add that BoF to your Schedule!!
item.description: You can set your own schedule and even add a Birds of a Feather (BoF) to that awesome flexible schedule of yours!
item.dc:creator: Bendygirl

item.title: SOLD OUT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
item.description:
It's true, Over 1200 of you are planning to attend the 4th annual Drupal GovCon North America and we're now officially SOLD OUT.

But there's more! Read on for how to find your ticket/registration and how to RELEASE YOUR TICKET if you can no longer attend...
item.dc:creator: Bendygirl

item.title: WIN a MacBook Pro at Drupal GovCon!!! - Yes, YOU!!
item.description:
Seriously, a Macbook Pro is the grand prize we'll be giving out at the closing ceremony on Friday afternoon.

So, you might be wondering, how do you win this prize? Well, this year, we're adding an interactive fun activity for everyone to participate. It's the Drupal Scavenger Hunt.
item.dc:creator: admin

item.title: Conference Hotel Information
item.description:
We sold out the Room Block at the Doubletree. We have negotiated a new room block at the hotel right next door for anyone who hasn't yet booked a room. Yeah, us!

We have a room block at The American Inn of Bethesda located at 8130 Wisconsin Avenue, Bethesda, MD. When booking, to receive the conference block rate, enter the GROUP CODE of 150720Drup. This rate is $162 and includes continental breakfast, WIFI, 24 hour Business Center and Fitness center, newspaper and shuttle service (Monday-Friday). The hotel block expires JULY 13th.
item.dc:creator: Bendygirl

item.title: Give a girl (or guy!) a hand
item.description: Our event would not be able to run smoothly without members of the community such as yourself. Please consider volunteering to help support Drupal GovCon.  We have many different volunteer needs, so please fill out the form with your basic information and volunteer interests.
item.dc:creator: jdearie

item.title: Don't Miss Leveraging Aegir on July 22nd
item.description: It's that point in our planning when we start to profile some sessions for the event. We're starting with this Drupal-As-A-Service session from Jason Schulte.   Jason and the Mobomo team will be take you through Aegir and how they use it to deploy high performance, high availability sites. Their session will teach you how to deploy Aegir to create secure, scalable architecture to manage multiple Drupal sites through a single interface.
item.dc:creator: Bendygirl

item.title: The Schedule is Up! The Schedule is UP
item.description: Thanks to our awesome community, we had nearly 200 session submissions! How crazy is that???  We worked with our speakers, moved some times around to adjust for speaker schedules, and now have a final schedule!
item.dc:creator: jdearie

item.title: Beginner Drupal and Project Management Half Day Trainings Tuesday, July 21st
item.description: This year, part of our Trainings curriculuum are two amazing half day sessions. There's Breakthrough Project Portfolio Performance from Fortezza Consulting and for the Drupal beginners out there we have Getting Started with Drupal from Fig Leaf Software. But it's probably better if we break this down a little into digestible chunks of awesomeness with some info on both of the presenters, their companies and what you might get out of the Tuesday half day trainings (ps, get your tickets ASAP before they're all gone!). So, without further delay, let's take a little look under the hood at Fig Leaf Software and also at Fortezza Consulting...
item.dc:creator: Bendygirl

item.title: Get your Training Here! Get Your Training Here! Get your Training HERE!!
item.description: I've been working with Capital Camp, Drupal Government Days and now Drupal GovCon since the start. Clearly, I need more of a life, but I digress. From the start, under the escalator in Chicago with Betsy and Kieran, we really just wanted to make sure our little event provided great training for all attendees. But this year, with our new name, the Core Code Sprint (don't forget to sign up), Webchick keynoting, and the tremendous response we got from session submissions (almost 170 for just 76 spots, just amazing), we just had to kick training butt, right? I mean, come on we totally had to kick this training thing up a notch, right?
item.dc:creator: Bendygirl

item.title: Ch-ch-ch-ch-Changes
item.description: I'm thrilled to be writing this announcement because this person was one of the first people I met in the Drupal community. She was definitely the highest profile one I'd met and there I was, one of 3 women in my class being taught by the likes of Eaton, Randy Fay and Webchick.
item.dc:creator: Bendygirl

item.title: CODE SPRINT!! Sign Up Now!!!
item.description:
At Drupal GovCon, join us for Drupal 8 Core extended sprints all week starting July 22nd, including Friday contrib sprints.

But maybe you're asking yourself, what is a "Sprint"? Keep reading, let's answer those questions!!
item.dc:creator: Bendygirl

item.title: Hoping to Attend Drupal GovCon in Bethesda? WE have SCHOLARSHIPS
item.description:
A Travel scholarship to be specific. 

So, if you're hoping to come on out, let us know why it's important to you and also some other basic information like anticipated costs and how to contact you!
item.dc:creator: Bendygirl

item.title: Traveling to Bethesda? We Have a Drupal GovCon Official Hotel!
item.description:
We are excited to announce that Drupal GovCon has a block of rooms at the DoubleTree Bethesda Hotel, July 20 - July 24.
 
The room rate is $162 per night for single or double occupancy rooms. This includes free WiFi, outdoor pool and double Hilton Honors points.  

To obtain this rate and reserve your room at the DoubleTree Bethesda, please email Andrew Reader at abpr@yeegotravel.com with DRUPAL in the subject line. This rate is not available directly through the DoubleTree. You must use Yeego Travel Meetings + Events for this rate.
item.dc:creator: Bendygirl

item.title: Session Submissions Have Closed
item.description:
Thank you so much for all the amazing sessions you've all submitted. It's been an absolutely incredible response. 

We are working on the schedule and will notify speakers as soon as possible of selection. 

Keep an eye out for our upcoming information on Training! That's right...TRAINING!!
item.dc:creator: Bendygirl

item.title: Ok, ok, we hear you.
item.description: While there have been over 100 sessions submitted to date, we've heard your cries for more time. The session submission deadline has been extended to April 17th. But this is your last chance - no more extensions!
item.dc:creator: jdearie

item.title: Submit your Sessions Now!
item.description:
We know you have awesome knowledge to share.

So, SUBMIT your session ideas now!

Session submission deadline is April 17th.
item.dc:creator: Bendygirl
